alert.note: Alert for Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Suffolk; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Isle of Wight, and southeastern York Counties, the City of Poquoson, the northeastern City of Suffolk, the City of Hampton and the southern City of Newport News through 1230 PM EDT... At 1200 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Beaconsdale to Kings Fork. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Christopher Newport University, Patrick Henry Field, Northampton and Beaconsdale around 1205 PM EDT. Newport News, Hampton, Langley AFB and Tabb around 1210 PM EDT. Seaford and Crittenden around 1220 PM EDT. Suffolk around 1225 PM EDT. Rescue around 1230 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Carrollton, Langley View, Longview, Benns Church, Wills Corner, Hilton Village, Chuckatuck, Indika, Dare and Hobson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Suffolk; York
